summ: The Panel discussed the Consultation Paper of the Hong Kong Press Council on qualified libel privilege with deputations and the Administration. [Paper provided by the Press Council] (Chinese version only) [Background brief prepared by the Legislative Council Secretariat]
The Panel discussed the protection of press freedom of the police's guidelines on media coverage with deputations and the Administration. [Administration's paper 1][Administration's paper 2]
The Panel discussed the protection of freedom of speech. [Administration's paper]
Hon Albert CHAN moved a motion on "Urging the Government to Defend Freedom of the Press and Freedom of Speech" for debate in the Council. The motion was passed. [Hansard "page 94"]
Hon Emily LAU raised a question on "Application for Warrants by Law Enforcement Departments to Search News Agencies". [Hansard "page 75"]
Hon Emily LAU moved a motion on "Defending Freedom of the Press" for debate in the Council. The motion was negatived. [Hansard "page 214"]
Hon Emily LAU raised a question on "Protecting Hong Kong Journalists' Freedom of Press on the Mainland". [Hansard "page 52"]

Hon Cyd HO moved a motion on "Safeguarding Freedom of the Press and the Right to Expression" for debate in the Council. The motion was passed. [Hansard "page 140"]

[Progress report from the Administration]
Hon Emily LAU moved a motion on "Defending Freedom of the Press" for debate in the Council. The motion was negatived. [Hansard "page 198"]
Hon Audrey EU raised a question on "Allegations Relating to Undue Influence of Representative Organ of Central People's Government". [Hansard "page 18"]
Hon Emily LAU raised a question on "Press and Demonstration Areas Outside Liaison Office of the Central People's Government in the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region". [Hansard "page 94"]
Hon CHEUNG Man-kwong raised a question on "Unauthorized Building Works Involving Chief Executive". [Hansard "page 65"]
Hon Claudia MO raised a question on "Measures to Facilitate Media Reporting in New Central Government Complex". [Hansard "page 71"]

Hon Charles Peter MOK moved a motion on "Safeguarding Freedom of Information, of the Press and of the Internet" for debate in the Council. The motion was passed. [Hansard "page 6"] [Progress report from the Administration]
Hon Charles Peter MOK raised a question on "Arrangements for Online News Media to Cover Public Activities". [Hansard "page 67"]
Hon Alan LEONG moved a motion on "Safeguarding Editorial Independence and Autonomy" for debate in the Council. The motion was passed. [Hansard "page 298"] [Progress report from the Administration]
